title: A man sells a watch with a discount of Rs. 48 and still makes a profit of 15%. What profit could he make if there is no discount and the cost price of the watch is Rs. 240? - Quora

response.answer_text: CP 240 with 15% profit=> SP=240(1+0.15)= Rs256.00. So,written price of watch with given discount of Rs48/- => Rs256/-+ 48=Rs304.00. Selling @ Rs 304/- would’ve made the profit as {(304–240)/240}×100%=(64/240)×100% =(4/15)×100%=(80/3)%=26.67% net profit. Ans..

Selling price = 240 ×115/100=276 rupees Discount 48 rupees to be added to the shop Ke TotaSP price as per his modality = 276 +48=324 Selling price =324 rupees Cost price= 240 rupees Profit =324-240=84 rupees % of profit =84/240 ×100 =35%
